bibl.title: Letter from Landon Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, April 29, [1954]

div1.p: Reed enthusiastically describes the ceremony to award the Finlay Medals and expresses regret that Hench could not attend.

div1.head: Letter from Landon Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, April 29, [1954]
div1.p:
We received your notes
yesterday and I am writing to
tell you how disappointed we
all were that you could not
have been with us at the
Embassy today - It was a
AC
R
very impressive and beautifully
managed ceremony and Gen-
Armstrong made an excellent
speech of appreciation but
of all the people concerned
I felt you were the one
who had made all this possible
by your untiring work and
interest in bringing to the
Cuban authorities attention
and help in restoring the
place where Dr. Reed did
his work. The “Finlay Medal”
is beautiful and when it
was given to Blossom she
received loud applause by
giving the Ambassador a
big kiss! I do hope you
will soon be entirely well
from your attack of
pneumonia and that you
will be coming this way before
long. I had a talk with
Mrs. Carroll who was there
With sent wishes from us both.
